title: Sans font with low bars on E and F
content:
It sort of looks like a pixel font or an Agency-like font. Any ideas? Any help from the esteemed panel would be greatly appreciated.

Thank!!

XOX

Candace

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141025154540/http:/typophile.com/files/font_157.jpg) | 1.75 KB |
author: ccottrel

comments.content:
Very small sample, is there something bigger?

Looks like one of the Art Deco fonts or some variation of Neutra Sans.

These might be close enough:

[http://www.christianschwartz.com/neutracond.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20141025154540/http:/www.christianschwartz.com/neutracond.shtml "http://www.christianschwartz.com/neutracond.shtml")

[http://www.houseind.com/fonts/neutradisplaythin](http://web.archive.org/web/20141025154540/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/neutradisplaythin "http://www.houseind.com/fonts/neutradisplaythin")

[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/triborough/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141025154540/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/triborough/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/triborough/")

ChrisL

Usually things that small are bitmap fonts for navigation tags. Have you checked bitmap fonts?

- Mike Yanega

Where did you get this sample? Are there more letters?

- Lex
This could very well be a hinting issue, that is, that the bar have been snapped to the closest pixel. Hinting behaves like that in some pixelsizes.

Thanks for the repsonses!

The site is here: [http://www.nutter.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20141025154540/http:/www.nutter.com/ "http://www.nutter.com")

They used it for the left nav and also for the flash movie.

Looks like Univers Condensed. :)

Kind regards,  
Martijn van Berkel

The crossbar on the "a" looks too sloped to be Univers.

ChrisL

Ripped this name out of the swf:

"CL Univers 47 CondensedLight"

(And the serif is "Century Light Condensed".)

Kind regards,  
Martijn van Berkel
You guys rule! Thanks a million, Martijn!
So it WAS a hinting issue with the bar on E – I knew it!
